alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 5:42PM MST until January 01 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Rain and Snowmelt in... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 537 PM MST, Stream gauge reports indicated rapid rises along Wet Beaver Creek and Beaver Creek. The gauge at Montezuma Castle reached 10.7 feet at 530 PM, which will cause dangerous flooding at low-water crossings. This flooding is being caused by heavy rain, as well as snow melt at higher elevations. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from rain and snowmelt. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Verde, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Rimrock, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, V Bar V Visitors Center and Wet Beaver Creek Campground. This includes the following swimming holes... Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area and numerous low-water crossings along Wet Beaver Creek and Beaver Creek from Lake Montezuma to Camp Verde. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Russell Wash, Walker Creek, Beaver Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Verde River, Rarick Canyon and Gaddis Wash. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
